body:
For the third update of the week, we've broken up guildmaster permissions into a set of granular options that can be toggled on or off for any particular guildmaster. If you've ever moderated on a certain alien-themed Ruqqus clone, you'll be familiar with the overall concept.

There are four categories of guildmaster permissions:

* **access** - Manage the exile and approved contributor lists
* **appearance** - Manage guild artwork and color
* **config** - Manage guild settings and description
* **content** - Kick, yank, pin, herald

Additionally, there is also **full** permissions, which is all of the above, plus the ability to invite new GMs, revoke invitations, and change permissions on GMs below you on the list.

All GMs are defaulting to Full permissions, since that's effectively what they were before this update.

By adding granular permissions, you should be able to recruit new guildmasters as needed, without the risk that they might add new guildmasters of their own or vandalize the guild.

Since this update is hot off the presses, you may need to press Ctrl-Shift-R (command-shift-R for mac) in order to load new site javascript.

body:
Cool. I'm going to try to find issues again (sort of).

* You can not see the guildmaster tools section of the sidebar if you don't have the config permission. This shouldn't be the case, since the tools there are still applicable to GMs without the config permission.
* You can see the link to the guild settings page from the 3 dot menu even if you don't have the config permission.
* You can become a GM while being exiled (I mean, you can pardon your own exile, but it still seems like a bug since you can't exile guildmasters). 1. Send an invite to @User, 2. Exile @User, 3. Have @User accept the invite

Other changes I'd like to see:

* If you're selecting a guild to yank a post to, the dropdown menu should only show guilds where you have the content permission
* More settings in +guild/mod/settings should give an error if you try to change them but don't have the necessary permissions (currently, it only shows an error message if you try to change the guild category, I think) (Also, if you change the guild name or guild description to invalid value, it still says that it's saved)
* Like others have said, since you can see who's been exiled or added as a contributor from the modlog even if the guild is private, would it make sense to make the list of exiled users and the list of contributors public?

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
Cool. I'm going to try to find issues again (sort of).

  • You can not see the guildmaster tools section of the sidebar if you don't have the config permission. This shouldn't be the case, since the tools there are still applicable to GMs without the config permission.
  • You can see the link to the guild settings page from the 3 dot menu even if you don't have the config permission.
  • You can become a GM while being exiled (I mean, you can pardon your own exile, but it still seems like a bug since you can't exile guildmasters). 1. Send an invite to @User, 2. Exile @User, 3. Have @User accept the invite

Other changes I'd like to see:

  • If you're selecting a guild to yank a post to, the dropdown menu should only show guilds where you have the content permission
  • More settings in +guild/mod/settings should give an error if you try to change them but don't have the necessary permissions (currently, it only shows an error message if you try to change the guild category, I think) (Also, if you change the guild name or guild description to invalid value, it still says that it's saved)
  • Like others have said, since you can see who's been exiled or added as a contributor from the modlog even if the guild is private, would it make sense to make the list of exiled users and the list of contributors public?

post.body:
For the third update of the week, we've broken up guildmaster permissions into a set of granular options that can be toggled on or off for any particular guildmaster. If you've ever moderated on a certain alien-themed Ruqqus clone, you'll be familiar with the overall concept.

There are four categories of guildmaster permissions:

* **access** - Manage the exile and approved contributor lists
* **appearance** - Manage guild artwork and color
* **config** - Manage guild settings and description
* **content** - Kick, yank, pin, herald

Additionally, there is also **full** permissions, which is all of the above, plus the ability to invite new GMs, revoke invitations, and change permissions on GMs below you on the list.

All GMs are defaulting to Full permissions, since that's effectively what they were before this update.

By adding granular permissions, you should be able to recruit new guildmasters as needed, without the risk that they might add new guildmasters of their own or vandalize the guild.

Since this update is hot off the presses, you may need to press Ctrl-Shift-R (command-shift-R for mac) in order to load new site javascript.

body:
I agree that mods should be able to add commentary to exiles (and IMO to all mod actions) but their ability to exile doesn't mean they are powermods, just mods with exile rights in a guild.

There needs to be a more fine-grained mod action than just perma-exile (even with explanation, as it really doesn't matter that much what the mod's reasoning is). Ideally there should be timed exiles too, to balance incentives a bit.

I started https://ruqqus.com/+exile_redemption just in case people think they've been too harshly dealt with and maybe we can talk mods into un-exiling some people.
body_html:
I agree that mods should be able to add commentary to exiles (and IMO to all mod actions) but their ability to exile doesn't mean they are powermods, just mods with exile rights in a guild.

There needs to be a more fine-grained mod action than just perma-exile (even with explanation, as it really doesn't matter that much what the mod's reasoning is). Ideally there should be timed exiles too, to balance incentives a bit.

I started https://ruqqus.com/+exile_redemption just in case people think they've been too harshly dealt with and maybe we can talk mods into un-exiling some people.

Cool. I'm going to try to find issues again (sort of).

* You can not see the guildmaster tools section of the sidebar if you don't have the config permission. This shouldn't be the case, since the tools there are still applicable to GMs without the config permission.
* You can see the link to the guild settings page from the 3 dot menu even if you don't have the config permission.
* You can become a GM while being exiled (I mean, you can pardon your own exile, but it still seems like a bug since you can't exile guildmasters). 1. Send an invite to @User, 2. Exile @User, 3. Have @User accept the invite

Other changes I'd like to see:

* If you're selecting a guild to yank a post to, the dropdown menu should only show guilds where you have the content permission
* More settings in +guild/mod/settings should give an error if you try to change them but don't have the necessary permissions (currently, it only shows an error message if you try to change the guild category, I think) (Also, if you change the guild name or guild description to invalid value, it still says that it's saved)
* Like others have said, since you can see who's been exiled or added as a contributor from the modlog even if the guild is private, would it make sense to make the list of exiled users and the list of contributors public?

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
parent.body_html:
Cool. I'm going to try to find issues again (sort of).

  • You can not see the guildmaster tools section of the sidebar if you don't have the config permission. This shouldn't be the case, since the tools there are still applicable to GMs without the config permission.
  • You can see the link to the guild settings page from the 3 dot menu even if you don't have the config permission.
  • You can become a GM while being exiled (I mean, you can pardon your own exile, but it still seems like a bug since you can't exile guildmasters). 1. Send an invite to @User, 2. Exile @User, 3. Have @User accept the invite

Other changes I'd like to see:

  • If you're selecting a guild to yank a post to, the dropdown menu should only show guilds where you have the content permission
  • More settings in +guild/mod/settings should give an error if you try to change them but don't have the necessary permissions (currently, it only shows an error message if you try to change the guild category, I think) (Also, if you change the guild name or guild description to invalid value, it still says that it's saved)
  • Like others have said, since you can see who's been exiled or added as a contributor from the modlog even if the guild is private, would it make sense to make the list of exiled users and the list of contributors public?

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

post.body:
For the third update of the week, we've broken up guildmaster permissions into a set of granular options that can be toggled on or off for any particular guildmaster. If you've ever moderated on a certain alien-themed Ruqqus clone, you'll be familiar with the overall concept.

There are four categories of guildmaster permissions:

* **access** - Manage the exile and approved contributor lists
* **appearance** - Manage guild artwork and color
* **config** - Manage guild settings and description
* **content** - Kick, yank, pin, herald

Additionally, there is also **full** permissions, which is all of the above, plus the ability to invite new GMs, revoke invitations, and change permissions on GMs below you on the list.

All GMs are defaulting to Full permissions, since that's effectively what they were before this update.

By adding granular permissions, you should be able to recruit new guildmasters as needed, without the risk that they might add new guildmasters of their own or vandalize the guild.

Since this update is hot off the presses, you may need to press Ctrl-Shift-R (command-shift-R for mac) in order to load new site javascript.
